comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Mary Bartelme (1866-1954) was the first woman judge of the Circuit Court of Cook County (Chicago), assigned to the Juvenile Court (1923-1933). She was born in Chicago and earned her law degree at Northwestern; co-founder of the Chicago Business Woman's Club, active in the suffrage movement and in reforms of the juvenile justice system. Her papers are at the University of Illinois at Chicago. www.uic.edu/depts/lib/specialcoll/services/rjd/findingaid...

comment._content: Thank you for the link, Richard, and a belated thank you to penny for the link to Mary Bartelme's papers at the Univ. of Illinois at Chicago.  These sources fill in the picture of this woman's historic life and work in Illinois.  We'll fill in her full name and birthdates the next time we update this record.  Thanks for your work!
